--- Comment #7 from Benjamin Schwendinger (<mailto:benjaminschwe@gmail.com|benjaminschwe@gmail.com>) ---
Since this change is already biting us, what is the best way to ensure that a
date is internally stored as integer or double?

e.g, are the following two sufficient?
`as.Date(as.integer(as.Date('2024-11-03')), origin='1970-01-01')`
`as.Date(as.double(as.Date('2024-11-03')), origin='1970-01-01')`

*[Bug 16594] svg of rasterGrob objects creates files Inkscape and Firefox unnecessarily interpolate*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=16594>

Paul Murrell (<mailto:paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz|paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz
         Resolution|---                         |WONTFIX
             Status|UNCONFIRMED                 |CLOSED

--- Comment #1 from Paul Murrell (<mailto:paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz|paul@stat.auckland.ac.nz>) ---
Unfortunately, the `svg()` device is one of the Cairo-based devices, so we do
not have direct control over the SVG code that is created by Cairo.  

You could do this via a post-processing step, e.g., using the {xml2} package. 

p.s. the link to the R-devel email thread was broken, so here is one that
(currently ) works:

<https://stat.ethz.ch/pipermail/r-devel/2015-November/072011.html>
